Articles.Content:
Hi, I'm new here and just recently bought the Steam version of KSP with the Making History Expansion DLC. I have the latest update 1.5.1 and currently running into the game crashing while in loading screens from buildings to launch pad or back out or loading a quicksave, etc...My PC is running Windows 10 with the latest updates, GTX 970 with latest updates, 16GB memory DDR4 2133MHz, i7 5930K 3.5GHz 6 core processor etc...I recently updated my BIOS and audio for my ASUS X99-A/USB 3.1 motherboard. My temperatures are all stable and games such as PUBG, play just fine. This game runs smoothly however, it keeps crashing when trying to load to the launch pad or switching between buildings. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling the game, including deleting the actual folder. I do not play with any mods and have not downloaded any previously.

I have seen some forums suggesting running 64bit due to memory limitations which I have verified I am running 64bit. I don't think it's a hardware or system issue. The game seems to have a problematic history. Just curious if anyone is having similar problems and had an easy fix.

Here is the output log if needed

https://www.dropbox.com/s/9ovn65wn1kcke1z/output_log.txt?dl=0

And here is the error log if that's what you really need.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/smhx9guiijr1x8c/error.log?dl=0
I don't see anything in the logs that imply there is a problem with the game. If you hadn't already done so, I'd have suggested you do a full wipe of the game and reinstall.

I have done a fresh reinstall of the game before. I uninstalled through the Steam and then went into the Steam common folder and deleted the file as well. Is there more that I may be missing when deleting the game? The game still crashes and have to force close the program to get the computer back.

I cannot see anything unusual in your logs either but I've noticed more crashes in KSP 1.5.1 as well, usually during loading screens. Also, this seem to happen more often if I play in window-mode and switch windows while the game is in a loading screen, especially in the inital loading screen.
So if you like to switch between windows as well, you may want to avoid it.

Thank you for the help. I do have Norton Antivirus running in the background and tried disabling it and also running the game in administrator mode. I was able to play longer than normal without a crash but wasn't trying to reproduce the problem. I'll report back if it continues to crash.

Edited December 17, 2018 by BoilerAviator13
Update: So I tried disabling my antivirus software and running the﻿ game as administrator and I’m still getting the same issue as before. No help. Any more solutions out there that may help?

22 hours ago, 4x4cheesecake said:

I cannot see anything unusual in your logs either but I've noticed more crashes in KSP 1.5.1 as well, usually during loading screens. Also, this seem to happen more often if I play in window-mode and switch windows while the game is in a loading screen, especially in the inital loading screen.
So if you like to switch between windows as well, you may want to avoid it.

I play in full screen mode and don’t switch between windows. Are you suggesting playing in window mode?

4 hours ago, BoilerAviator13 said:

Are you suggesting playing in window mode?

No, it's just the 'switch between windows' thingy which seems to cause some issues (at least for me). Since you don't do it anyway, I have no other idea, sry.
Crashes on scene transitions were an old sign of running out of memory which shouldn't be happening in 64bit in your case. But I still have to aks: have you tried playing without the DLC?

2 hours ago, Harry Rhodan said:

Crashes on scene transitions were an old sign of running out of memory which shouldn't be happening in 64bit in your case. But I still have to aks: have you tried playing without the DLC?

 I have not tried playing without the DLC pack. I’ll try it without the DLC and report back.

On 12/16/2018 at 11:04 AM, BoilerAviator13 said:

I have done a fresh reinstall of the game before. I uninstalled through the Steam and then went into the Steam common folder and deleted the file as well. Is there more that I may be missing when deleting the game? The game still crashes and have to force close the program to get the computer back. 

Just to be 100% sure, when you say you deleted files you mean in c:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\ ?

If not try that. If so... I don't know
The latest update 1.6 has fixed my issue. It must have been a memory leak issue which was no fault of my own.
